resources.string:
To prevent the spread of COVID-19:

 (i) Clean your hands often. Use soap and water, or an alcohol-based hand rub.

 (ii) Maintain a safe distance from anyone who is coughing or sneezing.

 (iii) Wear a mask when physical distancing is not possible.

 (iv) Donâ€™t touch your eyes, nose or mouth.

 (v) Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or a tissue when you cough or sneeze.

 (vi) Stay home if you feel unwell.

 (vii) If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention.
Accurate answers help us diagnose you better. Medical and support staff are valuable and very limited. Be a responsible citizen.
Are you experiencing any of the following symptoms?
Have you ever had any of the following:
Have you traveled anywhere internationally in the last 28-45 days?
Which of the following apply to you?
I have recently interacted or lived with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19
I am a healthcare worker and I examined a COVID-19 confirmed case without protective gear

Your infection risk is low. We recommend that you stay at home to avoid any chance of exposure to the Novel Coronavirus.

 Retake the Self-Assessment Test if you develop symptoms or come in contact with a COVID-19 confirmed patient.

 Do visit https://www.mohfw.gov.in/ for more information

Your infection risk is high. If the information provided by you is accurate, it indicates that you are either unwell or at risk.

 We recommend that you stay at home to avoid spreading of the virus and consult a doctor as soon as possible.

 Do visit https://www.mohfw.gov.in/ for more information
